text.0: how agni have the radiant ones aspiring endued thee with the vigour of the living.
text.1: so that on both sides fostering seed and offspring the gods may joy in holy laws fulfilment.
text.2: mark this my speech divine one thou most youthful offered to thee by him who gives most freely.
text.3: one hates thee and another sings thy praises i thine adorer laud thy form o agni.
text.4: thy guardian rays o agni when they saw him preserved blind māmateya from affliction.
text.5: lord of all riches he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.
text.6: the sinful man who worships not o agni who offering not harms us with doubledealing.
text.7: be this in turn to him a heavy sentence may he distress himself by his revilings.
text.8: yea when a mortal knowingly o victor injures with double tongue a fellowmortal.
text.9: from him praised agni save thou him that lauds thee bring us not into trouble and affliction.
